intro: Ophryoscleria riparia, commonly known as the riverbank beauty, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often vine-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ophryoscleria riparia thrives in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
